channel.title: Teachings on Sarah Schwartz - Stats
channel.description: Recent content in Teachings on Sarah Schwartz - Stats

item.title: Using R for Research
item.description: Have you heard about R, but don’t know where to start? After trying out R, are you still overwhelmed? Do you want to take your quantitative analysis to the next level? If so, then this is the class for you! 8 Wednesdays in Fall 2024 September (4, 11, 18, 25) & October (2, 9, 23, 30) 1:30 – 2:20 pm DistEd 109 or Zoom Open all faculty and grad students in CEHS Come learn hands-on in a lab setting during 8-weeks of step-by-step instruction on: * managing and reshaping data * quickly creating descriptive tables * exploratory and advanced plotting * transparent quantitative modeling * creating supplemental materials

item.title: Multilevel and Marginal Modeling
item.description: Multilevel Modeling is designed to provide graduate students with a practical, applied approach to the clustered and/or longitudinal data. Students will learn how to differentiate and appropriately select the best statistical methods for use in various research designs and analytical problems. This includes Multilevel Modeling (MLM), which also goes by such names as Hierarchical Linear Modeling (HLM) and Mixed Effects Regression (MER), Generalized Multilevel Modeling (GzMLM), and Generalized Estimating Equations (GEE).

item.title: Statistical Foundations
item.description: “Statistical Foundations” is designed to provide graduate students with a practical, applied approach to the application of fundamental behavioral and educational research design and statistical principles. Students will learn how to differentiate and appropriately select the best statistical methods for use in various research designs and analytical problems. Note: This course was historically called “Research Design and Analysis I” Focus This course will mostly focus on basic statistical techniques and several forms of the ANOVA model, which can be used by themselves or serve as building blocks for more advanced techniques in other courses.

item.title: Encyclopedia of Quantitative Methods in R
